programmes.show_description: The Hanging Oak. Charlie is being tormented by an oppressive black hooded figure, and the team discover she's got a sinister attachment. But who is he and what does he want? S4, Ep10
Dead In The Water. Becky and David bought The Old Watermill a few years ago, but it soon became apparent they weren't alone. The team contact several spirits; but why are they there? S4, Ep11
Teleshopping.
Best Sellers. Drew heads to Edinburgh, where he discovers an antique shop with a deluxe 1940s American bike. Later, he finds a mid-century designer desk in Wookey Hole. S11, Ep6
Eccentric People. In the Lake District, Drew meets an alpaca keeper and antiques collector fond of the unusual. And, at a Staffordshire castle, he meets an Elizabeth I lookalike. S11, Ep12
A couple searching for the ultimate getaway home explore the Algarve in Southern Portugal. They are looking for a home near a golf course for a budget of around £600,000. S2, Ep10

Prospective buyers around the UK wanting to swap hectic city living for a home in the country are shown an array of beautiful rural properties. S18, Ep58
Drew visits a huge collection of 20th century designer furniture in a former paper mill in West Yorkshire. In Middlesbrough, he finds pattern moulds at its last brass foundry. S14, Ep4
Drew visits the medieval Ely Cathedral in Cambridgeshire and finds pew connected a great Victorian architect. Later, he finds a WWII bomber crew seat at an aviation museum. S14, Ep5
Drew's at a 19th century Bradford weaving mill, where he discovers industrial trolleys and containers. In Cheshire, he visits a manor house mentioned in the Domesday book. S14, Ep6
Christina Trevanion and Mark Stacey set off on a south coast antiques hunt. Starting in Littlehampton, they travel north to an auction in Merseyside. S14, Ep6
Christina Trevanion and Mark Stacey's trip continues with the Cotswolds. They pick up a collection of Victorian jewellery and a grandmother clock. S14, Ep7
Toy restorers Julie and Amanda give a stuffed toy monkey a makeover. Metal expert Dominic frees a metal vice, and wood expert Will repairs a Scandinavian folk figurine. S6, Ep2
Les Dennis & Sherrie Hewson. Angus unearths some family fortunes at comedy legend Les Dennis' home. Then, he checks out a selection of movie memorabilia at Sherrie Hewson's house. S4, Ep6

programmes.show_name: Long Lost Family: What Happened Next
programmes.show_description: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell revisit the case of an ex-Premiership footballer and his birth mother. S7, Ep3
Woodworker Bruce Faulseit radically reinvents a tired antique desk. Meanwhile, lighting expert Duncan McKean repurposes two barley twist chairs. S9, Ep16
Nature In Design. Drew and Alister hunt for pieces inspired by nature, from a folk-art bird's head walking stick in Brighton to a fireside tiger in Shropshire. S18, Ep15
Antiques experts Louise Gostelow and David Harper begin their road trip in Ballynure. Louise eyes a curling stone, while David buys a Victorian chair. S20, Ep16

programmes.show_name: Secret Life Of The Auction House
programmes.show_description: Horseferry Road Furniture, Corgi Cars. A stainless-steel sculpture, a load of antique furniture and a collection of 1960s Corgi toy cars all pose challenges to the logistics team. S1, Ep6
In County Durham, Angus and the team clear out a huge aviation collection. Later, they help a retired policeman sell items from his four-bedroom home. S1, Ep8
Highway Men And Whores. Bassa Villa has had a haunted reputation for years. During investigation, the team discover a brutal murder has taken place at this 16th century pub and inn. S4, Ep12
The Spooky House. Rob has recently acquired a 19th century former B&B. Before his restoration, he needs to know if the property deserves its spooky reputation. S4, Ep13
Farm Of Horrors. Anita and her family have an idyllic smallholding, but paranormal phenomena have left them terrified. The team investigate who's there and what they want. S4, Ep14
Teleshopping.

An ambitious army veteran decides to settle down and start a B&B on the North Yorkshire heritage coast in Whitby. He has £350,000 to spend on a 5-bedroom property with sea views. S6, Ep1

Drew browses a salvage fair by Ripley Castle. In Newcastle, he visits a dealer of mid-20th century designer furniture. And, he and Tee check out an art collection in Hastings. S14, Ep7
Drew and Tee take a road trip in Hungary. In Budapest, they visit one of the country's biggest antique markets. Later, they unearth treasures in a former communist factory. S14, Ep8
Drew hits the Giant Shepton Flea Market, where he unearths some retro design classics. And in Devon, he visits Europe's largest repository of vintage fairground rides. S14, Ep9
Christina Trevanion and Mark Stacey are at their next stop in Cheshire. Mark purchases a home guard practice rifle, Christina buys a more unique item. S14, Ep8
Christina Trevanion and Mark Stacey carry on the penultimate leg of their journey in the West Midlands. They pick up antiques on the way to Stockport. S14, Ep9
The team revive a retro chandelier and an ornate mother-of-pearl table. Plus, a broken toy aeroplane doubles as a memento of a lost childhood in Iraq. S6, Ep3
Colin Jackson & Phil Daniels. Angus helps Phil Daniels with 1960s and 70s goodies in his Yorkshire home. Then, he finds the 2012 Olympic torch in Colin Jackson's family home. S4, Ep7

Back To Basics. With his new shop opening to the public, Drew needs more stock than ever. He spots a '60s Danish sofa in Malvern and a pair of tapestries in Welshpool. S12, Ep2
Louise Gostelow and David Harper hunt for hidden gems in Greyabbey. On their journey, Louise learns about the life of activist Mary Ann McCracken. S20, Ep17

programmes.show_name: Who Do You Think You Are?
programmes.show_description: Sue Perkins. Sue Perkins learns more about the German branch of her family. She uncovers a heartbreaking tale of fleeing refugees during the Second World War. S18, Ep6

programmes.show_description: Davina and Nicky revisit a woman who was looking for her American Air Force father, and a woman searching for her birth mother and sister. S6, Ep1
